column4: Downloaded a program and the user manual says .. To install Sweet Home 3D, move the uncompressed directory to one of your choice.     What directory should I use?
you mean the executable file? or the source code? what's in this directory?
well ... about everything that is part of the program
i'd move it to /usr/local (you'll beed to be root) and then link executable to /usr/local/bin
you'd link executable with a command like this (again, as root) ,  ln -sv /usr/local/<program_directory>/<name_of_executable_file> /usr/local/bin

when i do this command you gave me, will it show up in the Applications menu?     you'd link executable with a command like this (again, as root) ,  ln -sv /usr/local/<program_directory>/<name_of_executable_file> /usr/local/bin
no, it will not. use... System --> Preferences --> Main Menu
When I did that .... it already opens SweetHome3D ... so why do I also do that command ?
what did you do exactly? i'm not following what you're doing exactly that causes "already opens SweetHome3D"
I put the path to the executable file in System/Preferences/Main Menu
ok, sounds good so far
so what's wrong?
nothing I guess ... I was just asking if I still needed to do that command you gave me .....    ln -sv /usr/local/<program_directory>/<name_of_executable_file> /usr/local/bin
no
although I would like to be able to Alt/F2 and type in the program shortcut .... and that doesn't seem to work
only if you care about starting it up on command line, then you'd probably need that command
ok, that is like using the command line
using Alt+F2 is like using the command line
ok ... so I'll open a terminal and sudo that command.
roger.. good luck
"Good Luck?????"     :-)     ... that makes me nervous.
ok ... works wonderfully .... thanks for the help
cheers. you're welcome :-)
